entries.title: Web app completion and deployment
entries.whats_new: The AI-powered changelog web app has been fully developed and deployed on Railway and Vercel, enabling automated summarization of Git commits.
entries.breaking_change: The changelog web app now automatically summarizes changes based on Git commits, replacing manual processes and potentially changing how users view changelogs.
entries.impact: Users will experience faster, automated generation of changelogs, improving efficiency and consistency in change tracking.

entries.title: Enhanced configuration options
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM models, API keys, and related settings.
entries.breaking_change: The system now allows user-specific configurations of repositories and AI models, greatly increasing flexibility but requiring users to set up their preferences.
entries.impact: Users will have greater control over the changelog generation process and can tailor the tool to their specific needs.

entries.title: Multiple bug fixes and bug fixes on save methods
entries.whats_new: Fixed bugs related to saving changelog data to Git and GitHub, and resolved issues with the LLM bugs.
entries.impact: More reliable saving and data management ensures a smoother experience for users.

entries.title: Improvements in cache management
entries.whats_new: Implemented strategies for saving cache to GitHub API, local persistence, and applying entry limits.
entries.impact: Performance and data consistency are improved, reducing potential delays and data loss.

entries.title: Basic front-end web interface
entries.whats_new: A frontend interface was created for users to view the changelog, with auto-generated content from OpenAI, including dates, news, impact, and breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: The platform now displays auto-generated changelogs, altering how users review project updates.
entries.impact: Provides a user-friendly interface for viewing summarized project changes without manual input.

entries.title: Changelog detail view feature
entries.whats_new: Clicking on individual entries in the changelog now navigates to the detailed view of that specific log.
entries.breaking_change: The user interface behavior has changed to include detailed views for each changelog entry, enhancing navigation.
entries.impact: Users can now explore detailed information about specific changes directly from the overview.

entries.title: JSON cache strategy for frontend-backend connection
entries.whats_new: The backend generates a JSON cache file, which the frontend loads for displaying changelogs. Layout content is centered and icon changed to Greptile.
entries.breaking_change: The API now provides a JSON cache file as a standard, which may affect existing data access methods and display layout.
entries.impact: Improved performance and clarity in how changelogs are fetched and displayed.
